snippet: A report by the agency’s inspector general about officers embedded in the Police Department deepens concerns about domestic spying.
abstract: Editorial expresses deep concerns about report from Central Intelligence Agency inspector general that details agency's relationship with New York Police Department following Sept 11, 2001, attacks; cites serious threats to civil liberties posed by domestic spying; holds trend is all the more disturbing due to significant lack of centralized oversight.
lead_paragraph: A report by the agency’s inspector general about officers embedded in the Police Department deepens concerns about domestic spying.
